headline: Sean Fitzpatrick: "We must do everything we can to stop this war"
author: MATTHEW CANNON
sentences: Over the course of the following years, his All Blacks side went on to establish itself as one of the great teams in the history of the game, and the series win in South Africa in 1994 cemented their captain's place among the true legends of the sport .
Following the events of the past week, it's not a surprise that the Ukraine conflict came up in conversation, something that Sean, like many people, feels very strongly about.
In the past couple of days, sport's governing bodies have had their say on the conflict by imposing major sanctions on Russian national teams across virtually all sports.
Russia has "immediately been suspended from all international and cross-border club rugby activities as well as Belarus for its facilitation of the invasion."
In fact, on Tuesday any hopes Russia might have had of attending next year's World Cup were crushed following annoucements from World rugby.
The former forward and captain of New Zealand attended MARCA as part of a preview for the Laureus World Sportsperson of the Year awards .
The decision was made in line with the recommendations put forward by the International Olympic Committee.
Sean Fitzpatrick is considered by many to be one of the greatest rugby players of his generation.
He to this day remains a sports icon in his home country and the international rugby community.
He made 92 appearences for his country, and was crowned world cup winner in 1987.
Sean is the current chairman of the Laureus World Sports Academy.
To find out more, visit www.laureus.com.
